parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "script_language": "Bash",
    "framework": "MLPerf",
    "model": "RNN-T",
    "dataset": "LibriSpeech",
    "container": "dlc-pt",
    "resources": {
      "DGXSYSTEM": "DGXSYSTEM environment variable",
      "CONT": "CONT environment variable",
      "NEXP": "Number of experiments",
      "DATESTAMP": "Date and time stamp",
      "CLEAR_CACHES": "Flag to clear caches",
      "DATADIR": "/lustre/fsr/datasets/speech/jasper/LibriSpeech/",
      "LOGDIR": "./results",
      "API_LOG_DIR": "./api_logs",
      "SEED": "Random seed",
      "WALLTIME_DRYRUN": "Wall time for dry run",
      "METADATA_DIR": "Metadata directory",
      "SLURM_JOB_NUM_NODES": "Number of nodes allocated by SLURM",
      "DGXNGPU": "Number of GPUs per node",
      "NCCL_TOPO_FILE": "/workspace/rnnt/dgxa100_nic_affinity.xml"
    }
  }
}
```

The script is running on a SLURM cluster, likely on a DGX system. It sets up a container named `dlc-pt` and runs experiments with the MLPerf framework, using the RNN-T model and the LibriSpeech dataset. It uses a variety of environment variables to control the execution, including the number of experiments, the data directory, and the logging directory. The script also sets up several directories, clears the cache, and uses `srun` to run the actual experiment in the container. 

The `srun` command is used to run the experiment on multiple nodes, using the container and mounting the necessary directories. The script also uses environment variables to control the execution, including the number of experiments, the data directory, and the logging directory.
